In Terrorem.definition: by way of threat or intimidation

1.1: by way of threat or intimidation

2.1: serving or intended to threaten or intimidate [overbroad covenants not to compete which have
2.in terrorem: effect on employees "J. D. Calamari and J. M. Perillo"]
2.note: In terroremis most commonly used to describe a condition in a will that threatens an heir with forfeiture if he or she challenges the validity of the will.
